It doesn’t seem to be in the latest PhotonLib release for Java…

Grab the json from here on the WPILib GitHub, then load it in code using one of the static methods on AprilTagFieldLayout.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-02-02T00:20:32.879Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":178,"readers_count":177,"score":80.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":425449,"topic_slug":"where-can-we-find-the-k2023chargedup-apriltagfieldlayout","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/wpilibsuite/allwpilib/blob/main/apriltag/src/main/native/resources/edu/wpi/first/apriltag/2023-chargedup.json","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"allwpilib/2023-chargedup.json at main · wpilibsuite/allwpilib · GitHub","clicks":60}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52649,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7461 Prog/Elec"},"post_url":"/t/where-can-we-find-the-k2023chargedup-apriltagfieldlayout/425449/2","custom_user_title":"7461 Prog/Elec","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3138053,"name":"Nolan","username":"Quake","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/quake/{size}/236072_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-02T00:26:28.226Z","cooked":"

With the latest version of wpilib, AprilTagFieldLayout.loadFromResource(AprilTagFields.k2023ChargedUp.m_resourceFile);

We’ve tried that, it throws an IOException even when the path is correct. We have the json in our deploy folder and are passing in the absolute path.

What method are you using to load said path? Hopefully, this all will be made more clear in the next WPILib release with some contributions I’ve made. To load files from the deploy folder, you should be using the constructor of AprilTagFieldLayout.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-02-02T16:32:28.965Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":125,"readers_count":124,"score":45.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":425449,"topic_slug":"where-can-we-find-the-k2023chargedup-apriltagfieldlayout","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":56055,"username":"lol","name":"Adam","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/l/5daacb/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53361,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programming"},"post_url":"/t/where-can-we-find-the-k2023chargedup-apriltagfieldlayout/425449/5","custom_user_title":"Programming","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3138366,"name":"Tyler Veness","username":"calcmogul","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/calcmogul/{size}/128045_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-02T16:57:38.709Z","cooked":"

This is a bit cleaner:

AprilTagFields.k2023ChargedUp.loadAprilTagLayoutField();

But I dislike that it throws IOException because checked exception propagation is verbose in Java, and the member function name is inconsistent with the class name.

We had the same issue that it would throw an exception when trying to build the code ( I think was during a build). We wrapped that statement in a try/catch block, and it worked fine.
